Comment: Playing the most popular move by White in this position.

Bad move for Black. Since the e-pawn can be taken by the Knight. And if Black takes back the Knight, there will be a great counterplay by White.
These four moves are known as the Damiano Defence.
Black knows about the danger and doens't take back the Knight.
d4 is played to keep the line for both Bisshops open, just in case Black still wants to take the Knight.
But still, Black chooses not to take the Knight.
A Knight for a Knight trade, because if Black takes the Bisshop, it leads to a Mate in two.
Black still believed that the Knight was not a good idea to take, so he took the Bisshop. And we now know what will happen.
